events.title: Foundation of the Kingdom of Israel
events.description: Unification of Jewish tribes under the rule of King Saul
alternatives: Jewish tribes remain scattered
A confederation is formed instead of a centralized kingdom
Saul dies at an early age, and the kingdom does not emerge
consequences: Monotheism develops along a different path
Change in the balance of power in the Middle East
The absence of a unified Jewish state affects world history
modern_impact: Absence or different form of Abrahamic religions
Different geopolitical structure of the Middle East
Development of science and philosophy without the influence of monotheistic tradition

events.title: Foundation of Rome
events.description: Legendary foundation of the city of Rome by Romulus and Remus
alternatives: Rome is never founded as a unified city
Rome is founded by Etruscans, not Latins
Rome is founded several centuries later
consequences: Absence of the Roman Empire in the future
Etruscans become the dominant force on the Apennine Peninsula
Change in the course of European history
modern_impact: Absence of Romance languages and cultures
Different development of legal systems without the influence of Roman law
Different architecture and urban planning in Europe

events.title: Birth of Buddha
events.description: Birth of Siddhartha Gautama, the founder of Buddhism
alternatives: Buddha is never born
Buddha becomes a political leader instead of a spiritual teacher
Buddha's teachings do not spread beyond a small group of followers
consequences: Absence of Buddhism as a world religion
Different development of philosophical and religious teachings in India
Change in the cultural and spiritual landscape of Asia
modern_impact: Absence of Buddhist philosophy's influence on modern psychology and meditative practices
Different development of culture and art in Southeast Asian countries
Change in tourist flows and cultural exchange between East and West

events.title: Golden Age of Athenian Democracy
events.description: Period of greatest development of democratic institutions in Ancient Athens
alternatives: Athens remains under the rule of tyrants
An oligarchy is established in Athens
Sparta establishes hegemony over all of Greece
consequences: Absence of the Athenian model of democracy
Change in the development of political philosophy
Different influence of Greek culture on world civilization
modern_impact: Different forms of modern democratic systems
Absence or different concept of civil rights and liberties
Change in the development of education systems and civil society

events.title: Construction of the Great Wall of China
events.description: Unification and expansion of existing fortifications into a single defense system
alternatives: The Great Wall is not built, China relies on diplomacy
A network of fortresses and military settlements is created instead of the wall
The wall is built much further south, leading to the loss of northern territories
consequences: Change in relations between China and nomadic peoples
Different allocation of resources in the Chinese economy
Influence on the development of military strategy and fortification
modern_impact: Absence of one of the most famous architectural monuments
Different ethnic map of Northern China and Mongolia
Change in China's tourist appeal

events.title: Birth of Jesus Christ
events.description: Birth of the founder of Christianity
alternatives: Christianity does not emerge
Jesus becomes a political leader instead of a religious one
Christ's teachings remain a little-known Jewish sect
consequences: Absence of Christianity as a world religion
Change in the cultural and spiritual development of Europe and the Middle East
Different development of philosophical and ethical teachings
modern_impact: Different system of values and morality in Western society
Absence of Christian holidays and traditions
Different development of art and architecture without the influence of Christianity

events.title: Invention of Paper in China
events.description: Creation of paper production technology by Cai Lun
alternatives: Paper is not invented, silk and bamboo continue to be used for writing
Paper production technology is developed in another region
The invention of paper occurs much later
consequences: Change in the speed of information and knowledge dissemination
Impact on the development of education and bureaucracy
Different development of printing in the future
modern_impact: Delay in the development of mass education and literacy
Different development of information technologies
Change in the ecological situation due to the absence of the paper industry

events.title: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
events.description: Final decline and disintegration of the Western Roman Empire
alternatives: The Roman Empire successfully repels barbarian invasions and continues to exist
The Empire transforms into a confederation of semi-independent states
The Eastern Roman Empire successfully reunites the empire
consequences: Change in the political map of Europe
Impact on the development of feudalism
Different development of the Christian church
modern_impact: Different linguistic and cultural diversity in Europe
Continued use of Roman law on a larger scale
Change in the development of nation-states

events.title: Rise of Islam
events.description: Beginning of Muhammad's preaching and the emergence of Islam
alternatives: Islam does not emerge, Arab tribes remain pagan
Christianity spreads on the Arabian Peninsula instead of Islam
Muhammad creates a secular state instead of a religious movement
consequences: Absence of Islamic civilization and its influence on world history
Change in the political and cultural map of the Middle East and North Africa
Different development of science and philosophy in the region
modern_impact: Different geopolitical situation in the Middle East and North Africa
Absence of Islamic architecture and art
Different development of the banking system without Islamic financial principles

events.title: Coronation of Charlemagne
events.description: Proclamation of Charlemagne as Emperor of the West
alternatives: Charlemagne refuses the imperial crown
The Pope crowns a different ruler
Byzantium successfully opposes the creation of a western empire
consequences: Change in the political structure of medieval Europe
Impact on relations between church and state
Different development of the feudal system
modern_impact: Change in the formation of national identities in Europe
Different development of relations between state and church
Impact on the formation of the concept of European unity

events.title: Christianization of Kievan Rus
events.description: Adoption of Christianity by Kievan Rus under Prince Vladimir
alternatives: Rus adopts Islam
Rus remains pagan
Christianity is adopted in the form of Catholicism, not Orthodoxy
consequences: Change in the cultural orientation of Rus
Impact on relations with Byzantium and Western Europe
Different development of Russian culture and art
modern_impact: Change in the religious composition of modern Russia and neighboring countries
Different cultural influence of Russia on the world stage
Change in the architectural appearance of Russian cities

events.title: Mongol Conquest
events.description: Beginning of large-scale conquests under the leadership of Genghis Khan
alternatives: Mongols do not unite under Genghis Khan
Mongol expansion is directed only at China
Mongols create a trade empire instead of a military one
consequences: Change in the political map of Eurasia
Impact on the development of trade routes
Different development of technologies and cultural exchange
modern_impact: Different ethnic and cultural diversity in Central Asia
Preservation of ancient civilizations destroyed by the Mongols
Change in the spread of technologies between East and West

events.title: Beginning of the Renaissance
events.description: Cultural and scientific rise in Italy, the start of the Renaissance
alternatives: The Renaissance does not occur, Europe remains in cultural stagnation
The center of the Renaissance forms in a different region, for example, in Byzantium
The Renaissance takes on a religious rather than secular character
consequences: Change in the development of European art and science
Impact on philosophical and political thought
Different development of relations between church and secular culture
modern_impact: Change in the development of modern art and architecture
Different direction of scientific revolution and technological progress
Impact on modern concepts of humanism and individualism

events.title: Discovery of America by Columbus
events.description: Christopher Columbus's expedition reaches the New World
alternatives: America is discovered by another European power
The discovery of America occurs several decades later
America is discovered not by Europeans, but by Chinese or Arab seafarers
consequences: Change in the balance of power between European powers
Impact on the development of world trade and economy
Different development of New World civilizations
modern_impact: Different distribution of world languages and cultures
Change in the global economic system
Different development of agriculture due to the absence of crop exchange between the Old and New Worlds

events.title: Establishment of the East India Company
events.description: Creation of the English East India Company, which marked the beginning of the colonial era
alternatives: The East India Company is not created, colonial expansion is delayed
A European country other than England becomes the dominant colonial power
Asian powers successfully resist European expansion
consequences: Change in the development of world trade and the colonial system
Impact on the formation of capitalism and the global economy
Different development of relations between Europe and Asia
modern_impact: Different distribution of economic power in the world
Change in the spread of English as a global language
Different development of political systems in former colonies

events.title: Beginning of the Industrial Revolution
alternatives: The Industrial Revolution does not occur, agrarian society persists
The Industrial Revolution begins in another country, for example, in China
Technological progress follows a different path, for example, with an emphasis on renewable energy sources
consequences: Change in the economic and social structure of society
Impact on urbanization and demographic processes
Different development of technologies and scientific progress
modern_impact: Different level of technological development in the modern world
Change in employment structure and economic systems
Different development of environmental problems and approaches to their solution

events.title: Napoleonic Wars
events.description: Series of conflicts led by Napoleon Bonaparte
alternatives: Napoleon does not come to power in France
Napoleon successfully conquers all of Europe
Russia forms a long-term alliance with Napoleonic France
consequences: Change in the political map of Europe
Impact on the development of nation-states
Different spread of French Revolution ideas
modern_impact: Different structure of the European Union or its absence
Change in the development of legal systems and constitutionalism
Different balance of power between European powers in the modern world

events.title: Discovery of the Theory of Relativity
events.description: Albert Einstein formulates the special theory of relativity
alternatives: The theory of relativity is not discovered, physics develops along the classical path
The theory of relativity is discovered by another scientist, with different conclusions
Instead of the theory of relativity, a breakthrough is made in another area of physics
consequences: Change in the understanding of space, time, and gravity
Impact on the development of nuclear physics and cosmology
Different development of technologies related to relativistic effects
modern_impact: Absence or different development of nuclear technologies
Change in the development of space programs and satellite technologies
Different direction of development in fundamental physics and philosophy of science

events.title: Development of the Internet
events.description: Widespread adoption of the internet and the beginning of the digital era
alternatives: The internet remains predominantly a military technology
Closed national networks develop instead of the open internet
Global communication develops along a path different from the internet
consequences: Change in methods of communication and information exchange
Impact on the development of the global economy and e-commerce
Different development of social relations and culture
modern_impact: Absence or different form of social networks and online services
Change in work and education methods
Different development of privacy and information security issues
